crochet hook sizes pattern notes etc this pattern uses us terms see abbreviations list for uk equivalents you can use any yarn weight and crochet hook size but keep in mind that this might alter the size of your snowflakes in case you have any questions about this pattern please feel free to email me evescrochetcorner@gmail com materials any yarn weight of your choice with a corresponding hook size i used king cole cottonsoft dk 710 white emu classic chunky cream 102 3 5 mm crochet hook 6 5 mm crochet hook tapestry needle stitch marker scissors gauge not crucial for this pattern notes as an alternative of a magic_ring you can use the ch2 method to form a ring and work your stitches into the second chain from hook ch3 counts as first double_crochet round 2 ch1s worked in between the triangles mark all six ch1s if needed as they will be the base s of the snow crystals in the third round picot s pattern uses picots to create the snow crystals work them as follows ch4 slip_stitch into the 3rd chain from hook ch2 slip_stitch into the 3rd chain repeat 2 times pattern into a magic_ring round 1 ch3 1dc ch2 * 2dc ch2 repeat from * 4 more times join with a slip_stitch into the top of ch3 12dc 6 ch2 sps eve s crochet corner 2020 updated in 2022 rnd2 * ch1 and mark it with a stitch marker into the ch2 space work a slip_stitch ch1 1sc 1hdc ch2 1hdc 1sc ch1 slip_stitch repeat from* 5 more times join with a slip_stitch into the marked ch1 round 2 working into the ch2 sps rnd2 6 triangles created eve s crochet corner 2020 updated in 2022 working into the ch1s in between and around the triangles rnd3 * ch4 slip_stitch into the 3rd chain from hook ch2 slip_stitch into the 3rd chain two times single_crochet into the last rem chain slip_stitch into the ch1 again ch1 working into the middle of the triangle slip_stitch ch2 slip_stitch ch1 slip_stitch into the next ch1 repeat from* 5 more times join with a slip_stitch fo round 3 ch4 and 3 picots to create the
